About Workfiles

A workfile is a source file located on your operating system from which you create a versioned file. Serena ChangeMan Version Manager creates one archive for each workfile under version control. When you check out a revision, Version Manager stores it as a workfile in your workfile location. Each time you modify and check in a workfile, Version Manager creates a new revision and assigns it a new revision number. Versioned files within Version Manager store revisions and information about the location of the actual archive, where the changes are physically stored.

A workfile location is defined for each Version Manager project. This workfile location is, by default, the location where Version Manager places a revision checked out of an archive. Workfile locations are stored in workspaces.
